APPROACHING MILLVILLE, MA THERE IS A PRIVATE CROSSING AT MP 21.91 THAT IS EQUIPPED WITH STOP SIGNS ONLY. THE CREW WAS TRAVELING NORTH WITH THE LONG NOSE FACING NORTH. THE CREW BEGAN BLOWING ITS HORN FOR THE CROSSING, WHICH IS ON A CURVE, AND FOUND A TRAILER TRUCK LOADED WITH LOGS BLOCKING THE CROSSING. THE ENGINEER PUT THE ENGINE INTO EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION BUT HE COULDNOT STOP IN TIME. THE LOCO STRUCK THE TRUCK WHICH CAUSED DAMAGE TO THE LOCO AND SOME DAMAGE TO THE TRUCK. NO ONE WAS INJURED IN THIS ACCIDENT. THE REASON THE TRUCK WAS STOPPED ON THE CROSSING WAS THATHIS VEHICLE WAS TOO LONG TO FIT BETWEEN THE CROSSING AND THE MAIN ROAD TO WHICH HE WAS WAITING TO TURN ONTO AFTER TRAFFIC CLEARED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

EQ940802-d-08-15-94-LI.Primary Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
EQ940802-d-08-15-94-LI.Accident Cause: Cross level of track irregular (not at joints)
EQ940802-d-08-15-94-LI.Narrative: THE R4 WHEEL ON CAR 9805 FAILED TO PROPERLY NEGOTIATE THE RH SWITCH POINT ON "91 SWITCH" IN JAY INTERLOCKING, RESULTING IN A DERAILMENT OF BOTH TRUCKS ON CAR 9805. THE DERAILMENT WAS THE RESULT OF SEVERAL UNIQUE FACTORS, WHICH COMBINED TO AFFECT THE DYNAMIC RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN THE WHEEL AND THE SWITCH POINT: "91 SWITCH" IS A LEFT-HAND T.O., CONSTRUCTED IN A LEFT-HAND CURVE COMPOUNDING THE DEGREEOF CURVATURE AT THE SWITCH POINT TO 21 DEGREES. THE CROSS LEVEL AT THE POINT OF SWITCH WAS 7/8" WITHTHE RH POINT ABOVE THE PLANE OF THE LH POINT. WITHIN 48 HOURS PRIOR TO THE INCIDENT, ONE INCH OF RAIN FELL ON THE SITE; PUMPING OF TIMERS WAS VISIBLE, CAUSING THE 7/8" CROSS LEVEL TO INCREASE BY AS MUCH AS 3/4". IMMEDIATELY WEST OF 91 SWITCH, 85 SLIP WAS "CRIBBED" (BALLAST REMOVED) IN PREPARATION FOR RENEWAL, WHICH CAUSED SURFACE DEFLECTIONS PRIOR TO ENTRANCE TO 91 SWITCH. THE HEEL OF THE RIGHT-HAND POINT WAS LOW IN RELATIONSHIP TO THE POINT (PROFILE), CAUSING THE POINT TO SLIGHTYLY PROTRUDE FROM ITS HOUSING.NoneNoneNoneNone

A63-d-08-03-94-BRG.Primary Accident Cause: Other miscellaneous causes (Provide detailed description in narrative)

A63-d-08-03-94-BRG.Narrative: THE DERAILMENT OCCURRED WHILE BRG'S SWITCH CREW WAS PULLING SEVERAL RAIL CARS FROM THE LAST TRK (S25) AT BETHLEHEM YARD WHICH HAS 3 STORAGE TRKS - S23, S24 & S25. S23 IS THE INSIDE TRK, CLOSEST TO THEMAIN LINE & S25 IS THE OUTSIDE TRK, FURTHEST FROM THE MAIN LINE. THE SWITCH CREW WENT INTO S25 WITHA LIGHT ENGINE. S23 HAD SEVERAL EMPTY RAIL CARS THAT HAD BEEN IN STORAGE FOR SEVERAL DAYS. AS SWITCH CREW WAS PULLING OUT RAIL CARS FROM S25, THE CONDUCTOR HEARD A STRANGE NOISE & FELT A STRONG GUSTOF WIND (THE WEATHER CONDITIONS WERE CLOUDY WITH THUNDERSTORMS & A FUNNEL WAS REPORTED IN THE PORT AREA). IMMEDIATELY AFTER THIS THE CONDUCTOR, POSITIONED NEAR MIDDLE OF TRK S25, HEARD A LOUD NOISE THAT SOUNDED LIKE A COLLISION & RADIOED THE ENGINEER TO STOP. AFTER INVESTIGATING THE TRAIN, CONDUCTORFOUND RAIL CARS THAT HAD BEEN STORED ON S23 HAD ROLLED INDEPENDENTLY ONTO RAIL CARS THE CREW WAS PULLING OUT OF S25. CAUSE OF THE INCIDENT WAS UNDETERMINABLE. WE BELIEVE A STRONG WIND OR FUNNEL BLEWTHE EMPTY RAIL CARS ONTO THE RAIL CARS BEING PULLED OUT OF TRK S25. NO OTHER CAUSE CODE IN THE FRA GUIDE EXPLAINS THE PRIMARY CAUSE OF THE ACCIDENT.NoneNoneNone

002-d-08-10-94-MNCW.Narrative: ON AUGUST 10, 1994, AMTRAK TRAIN 66 DEPARTED NEW HAVEN STATION EASTBOUND AT 5:19 A.M.. TRAIN CONSISTED OF TWO LOCOS AND NINE CARS. AT APPROX 5:22 A.M., THE ENGINEER FELT A RUN IN AND THEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO AN EMERGENCY APPLICATION OF THE BRAKES. THE CONDUCTOR INSPECTED THE TRAIN AND FOUND THAT THEREAR MATERIAL HANDLING CAR HAD DERAILED THE REAR TRUCK AND IMPACTED A BRIDGE ABUTMENT ADJACENT TO TRACK #4. THE ENGINEER HAD MADE A RUNNING TEST APPROX 1 MIN. PRIOR TO THE RUN IN AND TRAIN SPEED WASAPPROX 10 MPH. INVESTIGATION COMMITTEE HAS BEEN UNABLE TO DETERMINE A CAUSE AT THIS TIME. IT IS KNOWN THAT THE DERAILED CAR TRAVELED APPROX 650 FT. FROM THE POINT OF DERAILMENT BEFORE STRIKING THE CONCRETE ABUTMENT. A SIMULATION OF THE CONSIST WAS USED SEVERAL DAYS LATER (BY THE FRA) IN ORDER TO RE-ENACT THE EVENTS, HOWEVER, AT THIS TIME NO AGREEMENT HAS BEEN REACHED REGARDING A CAUSE. PER MNCW ON4/12/95, FRA WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE CAUSE AT SIMULATION AND NTSB HAS FOUND A POSSIBLE CAUSE BUT HAS NOT NOTIFIED MNCW TO DATE.NoneNoneNoneNone

40827BOSAA-d-08-27-94-ATK.Narrative: AMTRAK TRAIN 467 STRUCK A MAINTENANCE OF WAY TOOL CART AT MP 23.9 ON THE HARTFORD LINE. THE LOCOMOTIVE WAS ESTIMATED TO BE TRAVELING AT APPROX. 78 MPH AT THE POINT OF IMPACT. THE TOOL CART TWISTED DOWN THE FIREMAN'S SIDE OF THE TRAIN AND UNDER THE EQUIPMENT. WHILE THE LOCOMOTIVE REMAINED ON THE RAILS, COACH 21256 DERAILED ALL WHEELS ON THE LEAD TRUCK AND COACH 21166 DERAILED ALL WHEELS ON BOTH TRUCKS. BOTH CARS REMAINED UPRIGHT AND IN LINE. THERE WERE NO INJURIES TO CREW OR PASSENGERS. THE ACCIDENT INVESTIGATION COMMITTEE DETERMINED THE CAUSE TO BE VANDALISM BY PERSONS UNKNOWN WHO DISENGAGED THE PIPE CONNECTED DERAIL AT THE NORTHEAST UTILITIES SIDING AND PUSHED A MAINTENANCE OF WAY TOOL CARTINTO THE HEEL OF THE SWITCH DERAILING THE CART AND FOULING THE SINGLE TRACK.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

AF7079-d-08-05-94-BRC.Accident Cause: Shoving movement, man on or at leading end of movement, failure to control
AF7079-d-08-05-94-BRC.Narrative: THE 4:OOPM BRC LEASE CREW WAS INVOLVED IN A SIDE COLLISION WITH THE 2:35PM BRC OUTSIDE INDUSTRY JOBAT CICERO AVE AT THE HIGH SIDE LEAD SWITCH. THE 4:00PM LEASE CREW WAS PROCEEDING EAST HANDLING CHLAXAND CHEGF POWER LITE ON A REVERSE MOVE TO THE EAST CLASS YARD, WHEN THEY WERE STRUCK ON THE REAR UNIT WHILE PROCEEDING INTO THE HIGH SIDE LEAD TO CLEAR THE THOROUGHFARE BY THE BRC 2:35PM OUTSIDE INDUSTRY JOB. THE BRC OUTSIDE INDUSTRY JOB WAS HANDLING ABOUT 40 CARS PULLING WEST OUT OF 44 EAST DEPARTURE WITHOUT AIR SWITCHING INDUSTRY CARS. BOTH JOBS HAD RECEIVED PERMISSION TO OCCUPY THE SOUTH THOROUGHFARE WITHOUT RESTRICTIONS OR INSTRUCTIONS TO WATCH OUT FOR THE OTHER JOB. THE INDUSTRY JOB SAW THE LEASE CREW AS IT WAS PULLING OUT OF THE DEP YARD AS IT CAME AROUND A CURVE UNDER THE CICERO AVE BRIDGE AND PUT THE TRAIN ENGINE INTO EMERGENCY BUT WAS UNABLE TO STOP SHORT OF THE LEASE CREW. THE LEASE CREW HAD PREVIOULSY STOPPED AT THE HIGH SIDE LEAD SWITCH AND THROWN IT FOR THE LEAD WHEN THEY OBSERVED THE INDUSTRY JOB. THEY ASSUMED THE INDUSTRY JOB SAW THEM AND WAS GOING TO STOP SHORT OF THEM WHEN THEY STARTED TO PROCEED INTO THE LEAD.NoneNoneNone
